title: Chain Bridge closed after dump truck overturns
text:
An overturned truck in Arlington blocks vehicles from entering the Chain Bridge on Monday. (Metropolitan Area Transportation Operations Coordination)

Chain Bridge was closed in both directions Monday after a dump truck overturned on the Virginia side just before the bridge, authorities said.

Arlington police responded at 11:39 a.m. to the accident on North Glebe Road near Chain Bridge Road, which shut down all lanes of the bridge. Drivers were being advised to seek alternative routes as delays were expected to continue for several hours, an Arlington police spokeswoman said.

Arlington County Fire Department officials said the driver was extricated from the vehicle and taken to a hospital with injuries that aren’t considered life-threatening.

The truck spilled a load of what appeared to be cinder blocks onto the roadway, and heavy-duty tow trucks responded to remove them, officials said.

Glebe Road was closed from Military Road to the Chain Bridge until around 3:30 p.m., while part of Chain Bridge Road also was closed. District police were blocking vehicles from entering the bridge from the D.C. side.

About 15,000 vehicles cross the bridge — which connects northern Arlington and upper Northwest Washington — on an average weekday, according to the Virginia Department of Transportation.
